com.epidemic_simulator

Class Strategy

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.epidemic_simulator.Strategy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SimulatorCallBack
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AggressiveContactTracing, ContactTracingLightTest, FullControlledLockdownAndStopSpread, MediumControlledLockdown, PercentageLockDown, PercentageLockdownAndPartialStopSpread, StopEpidemyOnFirstRed

    public abstract class Strategy
extends Object
implements SimulatorCallBack
    An object that represent a Strategy.
    A Strategy works alongside with a Simulator, in a similar way of how a SimulatorCallBack would do.
    The main difference between a Strategy and a SimulatorCallBack is that the Strategy methods are not called before the first red is found
    The difference is only in the fact that a strategy keeps an inner log of every encounter between every person.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  Strategy.ParameterData
      ParameterData is an Annotation used to specify the data of a numeric parameter of a Strategy.
      It is used by the SimulatorSettings for building the GUI dynamically.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected HashMap<Integer,HashMap<Person,List<Person>>> encounters
      The data structure holding all the info about every encounter.
      It is a HashMap that link every day number to another HashMap (used as a dictionary).
      The second HashMap links every Person to a List of the Persons they met.
      Example conceptual usage: encounters[12][mario] get all the encounters that mario did at the day 12.
      protected long originalResources
      The starting number for the Simulator resources when this Strategy was attached to the Simulator.
      protected Simulator simulator
      The Simulator attached to this strategy, this should just be used to issue methods from the simulator.
      Setting this variable to something else will not unlink this strategy from the old Simulator and it won't either link it to the new one

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Strategy(Simulator simulator)
      Instantiates a new Strategy.
      Link this Strategy to the Simulator passed as a parameter, set the originalResources and initialize the encounters dictionary.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void afterExecuteDay(Simulator.Outcome outcome)
      This method is called every time the Simulator finishes the simulation of a day.
      It can be useful for activating a strategy every day, or for running the Simulator in another Thread, and having callbacks.
      String clearOutput()
      Clear output string and returns it.
      This should be the correct way to get input data from a Strategy
      void dispose()
      Unlink this strategy from any data it has.
      On certain JVM versions it can allow for faster Garbage collection.
      It allows for lower RAM usages on multiple simulations, at the expenses of performances.
      protected HashMap<Person,List<Person>> findEncounters(int dayNum)
      Find the dictionary of the encounters for a single day NOTE: this is the same as doing encounters.get(dayNum), but it performs some additional error checking
      protected List<Person> findEncounters(Person person, int previousDays)
      Find the List of people that a Person has met in the last days
      void output(String text)
      Output a log string to temporary output that can be issued via clearOutput()
      void personClean(Person person)
      This method is called every time a Person become Person.immune after they had Person.symptoms.
      void personHasSymptoms(Person person)
      This method is called every time a Person develop Person.symptoms.
      void registerEncounter(Person person1, Person person2)
      Register that the person1 and the person2 met today
      NOTE: This should ONLY be used by the Simulator!!!

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • simulator

        protected Simulator simulator
        The Simulator attached to this strategy, this should just be used to issue methods from the simulator.
        Setting this variable to something else will not unlink this strategy from the old Simulator and it won't either link it to the new one
        See Also:
        Simulator#setStrategy, Simulator#addCallBack

      • originalResources

        protected final long originalResources
        The starting number for the Simulator resources when this Strategy was attached to the Simulator.

      • encounters

        protected HashMap<Integer,HashMap<Person,List<Person>>> encounters
        The data structure holding all the info about every encounter.
        It is a HashMap that link every day number to another HashMap (used as a dictionary).
        The second HashMap links every Person to a List of the Persons they met.
        Example conceptual usage: encounters[12][mario] get all the encounters that mario did at the day 12.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Strategy

        public Strategy(Simulator simulator)
        Instantiates a new Strategy.
        Link this Strategy to the Simulator passed as a parameter, set the originalResources and initialize the encounters dictionary.
        Parameters:
        simulator - The Simulator that should be linked to this strategy

    • Method Detail

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Unlink this strategy from any data it has.
        On certain JVM versions it can allow for faster Garbage collection.
        It allows for lower RAM usages on multiple simulations, at the expenses of performances.

      • afterExecuteDay

        public void afterExecuteDay(Simulator.Outcome outcome)
        Description copied from interface: SimulatorCallBack
        This method is called every time the Simulator finishes the simulation of a day.
        It can be useful for activating a strategy every day, or for running the Simulator in another Thread, and having callbacks.
        Specified by:
        afterExecuteDay in interface SimulatorCallBack
        Parameters:
        outcome - the outcome

      • personClean

        public void personClean(Person person)
        Description copied from interface: SimulatorCallBack
        This method is called every time a Person become Person.immune after they had Person.symptoms.
        Specified by:
        personClean in interface SimulatorCallBack
        Parameters:
        person - the person that healed from having symptoms

      • clearOutput

        public String clearOutput()
        Clear output string and returns it.

        public final void registerEncounter(Person person1,
                                    Person person2)
        Register that the person1 and the person2 met today
        NOTE: This should ONLY be used by the Simulator!!!
        Specified by:
        registerEncounter in interface SimulatorCallBack
        Parameters:
        person1 - The first person
        person2 - The second person

      • findEncounters

        protected final List<Person> findEncounters(Person person,
                                            int previousDays)
        Find the List of people that a Person has met in the last days
        Parameters:
        person - The person that should be used for the research
        previousDays - The number of days that should be looked up (NOTE: if days = 1 you will only search today)
        Returns:
        The list of the people that that person has met over the last days

      • findEncounters

        protected final HashMap<Person,List<Person>> findEncounters(int dayNum)
        Find the dictionary of the encounters for a single day NOTE: this is the same as doing encounters.get(dayNum), but it performs some additional error checking
        Parameters:
        dayNum - the number of the day that should be looked up
        Returns:
        The dictionary of the encounters for that day
